content:
Diagnosis:		Hepatoid adenocarcinoma of pancreatic body

Management:		Whipple's procedure 15 Jan 2024
		Adjuvant gemcitabine/capecitabine completed March 2024

Histology:		pT3N0M0 hepatoid adenocarcinoma, R0 resection
		AFP positive on immunohistochemistry

Current Situation:	Post-treatment surveillance

[redacted name] attended follow-up clinic today following completion of adjuvant chemotherapy. She has recovered well from treatment with resolution of previous chemotherapy-related fatigue and nausea. Her appetite has improved and weight has stabilized at 65kg. Serum AFP has normalized from previous peak of 2500 ng/mL to 12 ng/mL. Recent surveillance CT shows no evidence of disease recurrence. Blood tests show stable liver function and normal CA19-9. The plan is to continue regular surveillance with 3-monthly AFP measurements and CT scan in 3 months' time. She will be reviewed in clinic following these investigations.

cancer_timeline.value: AFP normalized from 2500 ng/mL to 12 ng/mL
Surveillance CT shows no evidence of disease recurrence

patient_facts.value: Resolution of previous chemotherapy-related fatigue and nausea
Stable liver function and normal CA19-9

status_updates.value: Stage IIA pancreatic hepatoid adenocarcinoma post Whipple's and adjuvant chemotherapy. Currently no evidence of recurrence with normalized tumor markers
Normalized AFP from 2500 ng/mL to 12 ng/mL
Surveillance CT scan in 3 months and 3-monthly AFP measurements
